It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.</feedburner:browserFriendly><item><title>The First Few Minutes Of The New DOOM</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/FdlCWyfc4Yo/the-first-few-minutes-of-the-new-doom-1776410161</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--8tyQqXJt--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/ewmxxdfdn6mh85ztpqsu.gif" /><p class="first-text">I just installed <em>Doom </em>on my PC. So let’s take a look at the first few minutes of id’s new/old shooter.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/the-first-few-minutes-of-the-new-doom-1776410161">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/FdlCWyfc4Yo" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">doom</category><category domain="">pc</category><category domain="">kotaku core</category><category domain="">id</category><category domain="">bethesda</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:20:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776410161</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Luke Plunkett]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/the-first-few-minutes-of-the-new-doom-1776410161</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Sandbox Survival, Minus The Gravity</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/Ipgq6y6us3A/sandbox-survival-minus-the-gravity-1776385535</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--567EjMmx--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/dqgoah9ofppqxp9mivih.jpg" /><p class="first-text"><a href="http://www.playhellion.com/features" rel="noopener" target="_blank"><em>Hellion </em></a>is a sandbox survival game. Only instead of being set on an island or a city, it’s set in the depths of space.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/sandbox-survival-minus-the-gravity-1776385535">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/Ipgq6y6us3A" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">indie</category><category domain="">pc</category><category domain="">hellion</category><category domain="">kotaku core</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:45:55 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776385535</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Luke Plunkett]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/sandbox-survival-minus-the-gravity-1776385535</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>As if there weren’t enough strategy games to get excited about in 2016, along comes Hearts of Iron I</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/XhiEIw016Uk/as-if-there-weren-t-enough-strategy-games-to-get-excite-1776380038</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--mah5RZKs--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/sp3ejknr0nd3iwhvoeu8.gif" /><p class="first-text">As if there weren’t enough <a href="http://kotaku.com/were-living-in-a-turn-based-golden-age-1762260608">strategy games to get excited about in 2016</a>
 <inset id="1762260608" />, along comes <em>Hearts of Iron IV</em> with its bombers and little men and <em>menus</em>.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/as-if-there-weren-t-enough-strategy-games-to-get-excite-1776380038">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/XhiEIw016Uk" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">hearts of iron iv</category><category domain="">paradox</category><category domain="">pc</category><category domain="">kotaku core</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:09:13 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776380038</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Luke Plunkett]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/as-if-there-weren-t-enough-strategy-games-to-get-excite-1776380038</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Fan Building Counter-Strike Surfing Game</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/NLFV8ZLCS4k/fan-building-counter-strike-surfing-game-1776374888</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--efGWWp9_--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/ufgty0jkbcdpepnsfzv6.gif" /><p class="first-text">Tired of <a href="http://kotaku.com/5904909/yup-the-new-counter-strike-has-surfing-in-it">surfing in <em>Counter-Strike </em>as an optional extra</a>
 <inset id="5904909" />, <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCifvbCBb-arRxWIRUgK0vg\" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Rory McHenry</a> is working on building his own standalone surfing experience using Unreal Engine 4.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/fan-building-counter-strike-surfing-game-1776374888">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/NLFV8ZLCS4k" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">counter-strike</category><category domain="">surfing</category><category domain="">cs go</category><category domain="">mods</category><category domain="">kotaku core</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:45:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776374888</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Luke Plunkett]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/fan-building-counter-strike-surfing-game-1776374888</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Sources: The Ambitious (Now Cancelled) Plans toy-centric <em>Disney Infinity </em>series is even more shocking given the tantalizing plans for the series that two sources close to the project have shared with <em>Kotaku</em>.</p><p><a Gronkowski</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/JuBXR7gCUnM/madden-17s-cover-star-is-rob-gronkowski-1776357690</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--hOwz--x3--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/zfomfkmzcxlq5m0ey6v1.png" /><p class="first-text">The next cover athlete for <em>Madden</em> will be Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski, EA announced this evening. Given that the Xbox Store leaked this news earlier today, the only real shock here is that he’s wearing a shirt.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/madden-17s-cover-star-is-rob-gronkowski-1776357690">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/JuBXR7gCUnM" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">madden</category><category domain="">madden 17</category><category domain="">kotakucore</category><category domain="">ea</category><category domain="">electronic arts</category><category domain="">editors picks</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:05:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776357690</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Jason Schreier]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/madden-17s-cover-star-is-rob-gronkowski-1776357690</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>The One Superhero Comic I Always Read When I’m Depressed</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/ukfUHwRH2Wg/the-one-superhero-comic-i-always-read-when-i-m-depresse-1776297650</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--5JuntPhq--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/gyafdi05gdyzd4joo0ld.jpg" /><p class="first-text">The Question was about as fallible a superhero as ever existed. In the very first issue of his solo comic in the 1980s, he got the crap kicked out of him and caught a bullet to the middle of his forehead at point blank rage. He died. He got better. But he never was quite good enough. That’s why I love him.</p><p><a href="http://io9.gizmodo.com/the-one-superhero-comic-i-always-read-when-i-m-depresse-1776297650">Read more...</a></p><img The secret one. You know, the one in chapter four. </p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/lets-talk-about-that-one-scene-in-uncharted-4-1776324764">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/Kuuau7uABUM" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">uncharted</category><category domain="">uncharted 4</category><category domain="">kotakucore</category><category domain="">sony</category><category domain="">naughty dog</category><category domain="">ps4</category><category domain="">playstation 4</category><category domain="">playstation</category><category domain="">editors picks</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:00:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776324764</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Jason Schreier]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/lets-talk-about-that-one-scene-in-uncharted-4-1776324764</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Free Sidescrolling Permadeath MMO Is Surprisingly Fun</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/67gWi3znljA/free-sidescrolling-permadeath-mmo-is-surprisingly-fun-1776302226</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--sjoQsWgQ--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/utji1yg8ms96vrrghycj.jpg" /><p class="first-text">I didn’t expect to get so into <em><a href="http://store.steampowered.com/app/420790/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">StarBreak</a></em>. It’s a free-to-play sidescrolling MMO—think <em>Contra</em>, but with, like, 30 other people swarming around you—where every death counts. If you die, loot and stats go out the window. Despite that, it’s weirdly relaxing to play.<br /></p><p><a href="http://steamed.kotaku.com/free-sidescrolling-permadeath-mmo-is-surprisingly-fun-1776302226">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/67gWi3znljA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">starbreak</category><category domain="">steam</category><category domain="">pc</category><category domain="">mmo</category><category domain="">kotakucore</category><category domain="">impressions</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:40:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776302226</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Nathan Grayson on Steamed, shared by Nathan Grayson to Kotaku]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://steamed.kotaku.com/free-sidescrolling-permadeath-mmo-is-surprisingly-fun-1776302226</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>The Power Of Textures</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/jdyVlN7HKyU/the-power-of-textures-1776153926</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--HB7YPklM--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/mnceoc5qtolejjdnoifa.gif" /><p class="first-text">Zeke Garcia is a 3D artist who has worked for companies like Microsoft, Bungie and Turn10.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/the-power-of-textures-1776153926">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/jdyVlN7HKyU" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">fine art</category><category domain="">kotaku core</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:00:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776153926</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Luke Plunkett]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/the-power-of-textures-1776153926</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Mod Turns Steam War Game Into A 64-Player Mass Effect Battle</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/E7OpC9elEjI/mod-turns-steam-war-game-into-64-player-mass-effect-1776310726</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--G_5GrsZO--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/lstxrdezazld1txo3xkz.jpg" /><p class="first-text"><em>Running With Rifles</em> <a href="http://kotaku.com/a-tactical-pc-shooter-thats-like-battlefield-meets-hotl-1696604207" rel="noopener" target="_blank">is basically top-down <em>Battlefield</em></a>
 <inset id="1696604207" />. Thanks to a mod, you can turn it into top-down <em>Battlefield: Mass Effect</em>, aka the game you never knew you wanted.<br /></p><p><a href="http://steamed.kotaku.com/mod-turns-steam-war-game-into-64-player-mass-effect-1776310726">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/E7OpC9elEjI" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">running with rifles</category><category domain="">mass effect</category><category domain="">pc</category><category domain="">steam</category><category domain="">mods</category><category domain="">kotakucore</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:30:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776310726</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Nathan Grayson on Steamed, shared by Nathan Grayson to Kotaku]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://steamed.kotaku.com/mod-turns-steam-war-game-into-64-player-mass-effect-1776310726</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Russia Just Tweeted a Video Game Screenshot to Show Chemical Weapons Trucks</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/_-XHqiO0Uyw/russia-just-tweeted-a-video-game-screenshot-to-show-che-1776301634</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--0_StjWSr--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/fl0r6sinrzaep426da40.jpg" /><p class="first-text">This morning the Russian embassy in the UK <a href="https://twitter.com/RussianEmbassy/status/730701444823826432" rel="noopener" target="_blank">tweeted</a> an image with the message, “Extremists near Aleppo received several truckloads of chemical ammo.” The only problem with the tweet? The image they used is from the video game <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Command-Conquer-Generals-Deluxe-PC/dp/B0000CE1GK/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Command &amp; Conquer</a>.<br /></p><p><a href="http://factually.gizmodo.com/russia-just-tweeted-a-video-game-screenshot-to-show-che-1776301634">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/_-XHqiO0Uyw" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">video games</category><category domain="">isis</category><category domain="">russia</category><category domain="">terrorism</category><category domain="">command and conquer</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:54:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776301634</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Matt Novak on Factually, shared by Riley MacLeod to Kotaku]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://factually.gizmodo.com/russia-just-tweeted-a-video-game-screenshot-to-show-che-1776301634</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Hitman’s Elusive Targets will be coming “at some point on Friday during European hours,” according t</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/s-GOfQ9yEsI/hitman-s-elusive-targets-will-be-coming-at-some-point-1776315645</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--7qbYca6I--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/ijhoedydkbeibupvyilo.jpg" /><p class="first-text"><strong><em>Hitman</em>’s Elusive Targets will be coming “at some point on Friday during European hours,” </strong><a href="https://hitman.com/news/this-week-in-hitman-11-5-16" rel="noopener" target="_blank">according to Io’s blog</a>. One player, however, has already managed to beat the entire thing on a single life. Funnily enough, the toughest challenge Kyle Hinckley faced along the way wasn’t something like starvation or damage, but rather a nearly catastrophic glitch.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/the-fallout-4-survival-permadeath-run-that-turned-prest-1776289180">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/kotaku/full/~4/9n-0HpWLPew" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">fallout</category><category domain="">fallout 4</category><category domain="">bethesda</category><category domain="">permadeath</category><category domain="">watch this</category><category domain="">youtube</category><category domain="">kotaku core</category><category domain="">editors picks</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:00:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776289180</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patricia Hernandez]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/the-fallout-4-survival-permadeath-run-that-turned-prest-1776289180</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Toy Time Plays With He-Men, The Most Powerful Men In The Universe</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/kotaku/full/~3/EAEanfgren4/toy-time-plays-with-he-men-the-most-powerful-men-in-th-1776284611</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--pwSDw67k--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/re3avhatxxc2ym8s4ffr.jpg" /><p class="first-text">If you’re a He-Man fan that likes to keep their MattyCollector.com figures pristine in their packaging then look away.
